info.title: AmazonConnectCampaignService
info.description: Provide APIs to create and manage Amazon Connect Campaigns.

servers.description: The AmazonConnectCampaignService endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The AmazonConnectCampaignService endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

put.description: Creates a campaign for the specified Amazon Connect account. This API is idempotent.

arn.description: The resource name of an Amazon Connect campaign.

tags.description: Tag map with key and value.

schema.description: The response for Create Campaign API

dialerConfig.description: The possible types of dialer config parameters

bandwidthAllocation.description: The bandwidth allocation of a queue resource.
The bandwidth allocation of a queue resource.

name.description: The name of an Amazon Connect Campaign name.

outboundCallConfig.description: The configuration used for outbound calls.

allOf.description: Enable or disable answering machine detection

connectContactFlowId.description: The identifier of the contact flow for the outbound call.

connectQueueId.description: The queue for the call. If you specify a queue, the phone displayed for caller ID is the phone number specified in the queue. If you do not specify a queue, the queue defined in the contact flow is used. If you do not specify a queue, you must specify a source phone number.

connectSourcePhoneNumber.description: The phone number associated with the Amazon Connect instance, in E.164 format. If you do not specify a source phone number, you must specify a queue.

tags.description: Tag map with key and value.

post.description: Get state of campaigns for the specified Amazon Connect account.

failedRequests.description: List of failed requests of campaign state

failureCode.description: A predefined code indicating the error that caused the failure in getting state of campaigns

successfulRequests.description: List of successful response of campaign state

post.description: Provides summary information about the campaigns under the specified Amazon Connect account.

campaignSummaryList.description: A list of Amazon Connect campaigns.

arn.description: The resource name of an Amazon Connect campaign.

name.description: The name of an Amazon Connect Campaign name.

nextToken.description: The token for the next set of results.

operator.description: Operators for Connect instance identifier filter

maxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return per page.

nextToken.description: The token for the next set of results.

delete.description: Deletes a campaign from the specified Amazon Connect account.

arn.description: The resource name of an Amazon Connect campaign.

bandwidthAllocation.description: The bandwidth allocation of a queue resource.

allOf.description: Enable or disable answering machine detection

connectContactFlowId.description: The identifier of the contact flow for the outbound call.

connectQueueId.description: The queue for the call. If you specify a queue, the phone displayed for caller ID is the phone number specified in the queue. If you do not specify a queue, the queue defined in the contact flow is used. If you do not specify a queue, you must specify a source phone number.

connectSourcePhoneNumber.description: The phone number associated with the Amazon Connect instance, in E.164 format. If you do not specify a source phone number, you must specify a queue.

outboundCallConfig.description: The configuration used for outbound calls.

tags.description: Tag map with key and value.

put.description: Creates dials requests for the specified campaign Amazon Connect account. This API is idempotent.

clientToken.description: Client provided parameter used for idempotency. Its value must be unique for each request.

failureCode.description: A predefined code indicating the error that caused the failure.

items.description: A failed request identified by the unique client token.

successfulRequests.description: A list of successful requests identified by the unique client token.

clientToken.description: Client provided parameter used for idempotency. Its value must be unique for each request.

items.description: A successful request identified by the unique client token.

attributes.description: A custom key-value pair using an attribute map. The attributes are standard Amazon Connect attributes, and can be accessed in contact flows just like any other contact attributes.

clientToken.description: Client provided parameter used for idempotency. Its value must be unique for each request.

expirationTime.description: Timestamp with no UTC offset or timezone

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the customer, in E.164 format.

items.description: A dial request for a campaign.

post.description: Updates the dialer config of a campaign. This API is idempotent.

dialerConfig.description: The possible types of dialer config parameters

bandwidthAllocation.description: The bandwidth allocation of a queue resource.
The bandwidth allocation of a queue resource.

post.description: Updates the name of a campaign. This API is idempotent.

name.description: The name of an Amazon Connect Campaign name.

post.description: Updates the outbound call config of a campaign. This API is idempotent.

allOf.description: Enable or disable answering machine detection

connectContactFlowId.description: The identifier of the contact flow for the outbound call.

connectSourcePhoneNumber.description: The phone number associated with the Amazon Connect instance, in E.164 format. If you do not specify a source phone number, you must specify a queue.

post.description: Pauses a campaign for the specified Amazon Connect account.
Stops a campaign for the specified Amazon Connect account.
Starts a campaign for the specified Amazon Connect account.

get.description: Get state of a campaign for the specified Amazon Connect account.

post.description: Stops a campaign for the specified Amazon Connect account.

delete.description: Deletes a connect instance config from the specified AWS account.

get.description: Get the specific Connect instance config.

enabled.description: Boolean to indicate if custom encryption has been enabled.

keyArn.description: KMS key id/arn for encryption config.

encryptionConfig.description: Encryption config for Connect Instance. Note that sensitive data will always be encrypted. If disabled, service will perform encryption with its own key. If enabled, a KMS key id needs to be provided and KMS charges will apply. KMS is only type supported

delete.description: Delete the Connect Campaigns onboarding job for the specified Amazon Connect instance.

get.description: Get the specific instance onboarding job status.

failureCode.description: Enumeration of the possible failure codes for instance onboarding job

status.description: Enumeration of the possible states for instance onboarding job

put.description: Onboard the specific Amazon Connect instance to Connect Campaigns.
